message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.DB

Reasoning: The paper investigates the spread of ideas in computer science and the role of faculty hiring networks in shaping this spread. The paper also uses empirical data and epidemic models to analyze the impact of where an idea originates on its diffusion across the network. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks), cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.CY (Computers and Society), and cs.DB (Databases).
